page.title: 07Sandwich local history.
page.content: Sandwich is as old as British Urban Civilisation and shows clearly the continuity of this heritage and its evolution over more than a thousand years. The physical pattern of the original mediaeval town survives intact and it contains buildings representative of the Middle Ages, and all historic periods since then. Within the walled town 170 buildings are on the statutory list of buildings of architectural or historic interest with 140 on the reserve list. The numerous narrow and irregularly laid out streets of the old town are crammed with buildings of all shapes and sizes. Only in a few areas is the scale of development relatively large; mainly it is small and 'domestic'. Taken as a whole this kind of urban pattern is the most vulnerable to the pressures of modern traffic.
